Module com.calendarfx.app
Package com.serenitask.controller

Class RoutineOneController

java.lang.Object
com.serenitask.controller.RoutineOneController
public class RoutineOneController extends Object
Class representing Routine 1 of the Optimizer pipeline. This routine handles the allocation of goals that require x time per repeating period y.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final int
    allocationThreshold
    The minimum threshold for allocation.
    private final int
    blockSize
    The size of each block in the allocation process, set to 7 by default.
    private final LocalTime
    DayEnd
    The end time of the day for goal allocation.
    private final LocalTime
    DayStart
    The start time of the day for goal allocation.
    private final String
    TargetCalendar
    The name of the target calendar for goal allocation, set to "Goals" by default.

  • Constructor Details

    • RoutineOneController

      public RoutineOneController(LocalTime dayStart, LocalTime dayEnd, int allocationThreshold)
      Constructor for RoutineOne, Represents the complex routine used for allocating goals into events.
      Parameters:
      dayStart - LocalTime object representing the Start of users day
      dayEnd - LocalTime object representing the End of users day
      allocationThreshold - integer value of days to allocate ahead. 7 = 1 week;

  • Method Details

    • runRoutine

      public void runRoutine(com.calendarfx.model.CalendarSource mainSource)
      Simple execution function that executes routine 1 of the optimizer. This routine handles the allocation of goals that require x time per repeating period y.
      Parameters:
      mainSource - the Calendar Source that provides access to the calendars main source.

    • getGoalList

      private List<Goal> getGoalList()
      Extracts all goals from the database and returns them as a list. Goals extracted are of the type: requires x time per repeating period of y.
      Returns:
      List of all goals from the database

    • parseGoalList

      private List<Goal> parseGoalList(List<Goal> goalList)
      Parses the goal list and determines which goals require allocation. Goals allocated to or beyond the allocation threshold are not required to be allocated.
      Parameters:
      goalList - List of all goals requiring x time per y period
      Returns:
      List of goals requiring allocation

    • allocateGoal

      private void allocateGoal(Goal goal, List<Event> eventList, com.calendarfx.model.Calendar goalCalendar)
      Allocates goals based on their required time per period. Accounts for partial and full allocation periods.
      Parameters:
      goal - A goal object that requires calendar entry allocations
      goalCalendar - is the Calendar object that holds all goals.
      eventList - A list containing all events draw from the database to be parsed.

    • calcAllocatedUntil

      private LocalDate calcAllocatedUntil(Goal goal)
      Calculates the next date for allocation based on the current allocatedUntil value of a goal.
      Parameters:
      goal - The goal for which the next allocation date is calculated.
      Returns:
      The next allocation date. If the allocatedUntil date is in the past or today, returns tomorrow's date. If allocatedUntil is in the future, returns allocatedUntil plus one day.

    • allocateBlock

      private List<com.calendarfx.model.Entry<?>> allocateBlock(int blockTarget, Goal goal, List<Event> eventList)
      Sophisticated allocation algorithm that takes in a blockTarget value, a goal and an eventList. Processes these given parameters to allocate period based goals into events and store them in the calendar. Used to generate period based goals: I want to do "goal" for x hours per y period.
      Parameters:
      blockTarget - int value representing minutes of time required to be allocated
      goal - current goal having time allocated
      eventList - raw list of events drawn from database
      Returns:
      returns a list of entries to be added to calendar

    • getDaysList

      private List<Day> getDaysList(List<List<Event>> rawDaysLists, LocalDate date)
      Takes in a List of Lists containing events sorted by day. Uses events per day to evaluate available TimeWindows available for allocation. Each list of events is converted to a Day which contains a List of Windows.
      Parameters:
      rawDaysLists - List of lists containing events, sorted by date
      date - Localdate object representing starting date of allocation
      Returns:
      List of Day objects

    • prioritizeDays

      private List<Day> prioritizeDays(List<Day> rawDays)
      Takes in an unsorted List of day objects and sorts them based on the amount of unallocated time. returns a sorted list of days from most free time to least. Additionally, assigns priority to the day objects based on ordering.
      Parameters:
      rawDays - Raw day objects in list form. Unsorted, unprioritied.
      Returns:
      Sorted Day List, from most free time to least.

    • getDifferenceSunday

      private int getDifferenceSunday(LocalDate date)
      Takes in a LocalDate value, and returns the integer difference between the date given and the closest following sunday. If the given date is in the past, the present difference is calculated
      Parameters:
      date - any LocalDate object
      Returns:
      int difference
